page.title: 03Thurnham
page.content: Barley is grown for feed, and harvested by contractors with combine harvesters. Straw is baled and used for bedding. Hay is baled and stored on lofts in the barns. Slurry (liquid manure) is stored in towers or tanks and is spread by tanker. Soils are tested and the appropriate fertilisers are applied. The main dykes (ditches) are cleaned out by the North West Water Authority, and the rest are done by the farmers. Reeds are cut with scythes and either burnt or used as bedding. Land is drained by farmers usually using clay tiles (drain pipes).
